page.title: 03THE RIVER DOVE
page.content: The River Dove follows a meandering path towards Uttoxeter and the South. At some points the river is as wide as 20 feet and probably as deep as 15 feet. The river doesn't flow very fast but after severe rain it has been known to burst its banks and flood considerable areas, despite some steeply banked parts.Two large iron bridges are in use for crossing the river.The Dove also provides good canoeing and fishing especially perch and salmon.A permit must be obtained before fishing can take place,either from Uttoxeter County Council or J.C.Bamfords. On either side of the river the land is used for farming, mainly beef or milking cattle. A wide variety of wildlife and flowers are also hosted by the river, along with the Churnet, one of the Doves small tributaries.
